tasks.task: Trimming and Pruning a Fruit Tree
subtasks: Identify branches that are leggy or growing too long
Remove low-hanging branches that could interfere with equipment
Thin out the crown, keeping a central leader and removing overly vigorous branches
Bend and tie branches to direct growth and encourage fruit production
Use a stakes or bamboo to support newly pruned branches
Determine appropriate spacing for fruit using the "hand rule" (thumb to little finger span)
Identify clusters of developing fruit and selectively remove excess fruits to improve yield
Remove excess leaves to prevent disease and allow better fruit development
Review pruning techniques for young and mature trees
Prepare for future pruning cycles to maintain tree structure and optimal fruit production
Learn the importance of thinning fruit for better yield and quality
